message.entry: First argument to {0} must be a MatFile object.
Use function syntax such as {0}(obj) for method calls on MatFile objects.
Cannot access ''{0}'' because ''{1}'' does not exist.
''{0}'' does not exist in ''{1}''.
Cannot index into ''{0}'' because MatFile objects only support '()' indexing.
Cannot index into ''{0}'' because ranges for MatFile objects must increase in equally spaced intervals.
'Properties' describes a MatFile object. To access this description, use the syntax obj.Properties.name.
Cannot create a variable named 'Properties' because it is a reserved name for the MatFile class. Choose a different variable name.
Cannot change ''{0}'' because Properties.Writable is false. To modify ''{1}'', set Properties.Writable to true.
MatFile objects must be scalar. Try assigning the object to a scalar variable.
MatFile objects are scalar. Access variables using the syntax objName.varName(indices).
Variable name must be a character vector.
The file ''{0}'' was saved in a format that does not support partial loading. Temporarily loading variable ''{1}'' into memory. To use partial loading efficiently, save MAT-files with the -v7.3 flag.
''{0}'' contains a variable named 'Properties', which MatFile objects cannot access. To access the 'Properties' variable using a MatFile object, rename the variable in the file.
Cannot concatenate MatFile objects.
Variables in the MatFile cannot be indexed more than one level.
Writable parameter must be a scalar logical.
Cannot create empty MatFile objects.
''{0}'' cannot be indexed with class ''{1}''. Indices must be numeric.
Cannot use colon '':'' to define a dimension of a new variable.
Cannot index into ''{0}'' because indices cannot be empty.
Cannot index into empty variable ''{0}'' with colon index.
Subscript indices must be real positive integers.
To index into ''{0}'', specify all {1,number,integer} dimensions. MatFile objects do not support linear indexing.
To index into the new variable ''{0}'', specify at least two dimensions. MatFile objects do not support linear indexing.
The variable ''{0}'' is of class ''{1}''. To use ''{2}'', load the entire variable.
Found characters the default encoding is unable to represent.
MAT and FIG files save format
Save MAT and FIG files that can be loaded in:
MATLAB R2006b (Version 7.3) or later\nVariables can exceed 2GB on 64-bit systems
MATLAB R14 (Version 7) or later\nFiles are compressed and use Unicode character encoding
MATLAB R8 (Version 5) or later
Note: FIG-files are created by saving plots, GUIs, etc.
Sparse matrix of unsupported datatype. Matrix has been converted to double.
Sparse matrix of unsupported datatype. Load the complete matrix from the .mat file before indexing into the matrix.
